snippet: The federal government will shut down for the first time in nearly two decades after last-minute moves in both chambers of Congress failed to break a bitter budget standoff over the president’s health care law.
abstract: Federal government will shut down for the first time in nearly two decades after last-minute moves in both chambers of Congress fail to break a bitter budget standoff over the health care reform law; impasse means that 800,000 federal workers will be furloughed and more than a million others will be asked to work without pay.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and JEREMY W. PETERS

lead_paragraph: The federal government will shut down for the first time in nearly two decades after last-minute moves in both chambers of Congress failed to break a bitter budget standoff over the president’s health care law.

headline.sub: Senate Rejects House Demands to Curb Health Law
headline.main: Government Shuts Down in Budget Impasse
headline.print_headline: U.S. Government Is Shutting Down In Fiscal Impasse

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
